name: I Had a Holy Thought (it Vanished with the Day)
description:
My sense of wonder dissolves 
as reality falls into place, 
slaps me in the face, 
laughs at my sleeping instinct 
and skips merrily about my bed, 
juggling circumstance and outcomes. 

Chance. Fatigue. Broadened 
highways slither through Spanish moss 
covered trees, in swamps of 
my unconscious, wavering pen, producing 
all but my own self-esteem, 
which was tossed to the thing, 
was devoured and left as waste 
on the soggy earth. 

I shall take refuge in my room, 
sanctum of inherited quietness. 
Forbidden truths eclipse the Moon, 
and tenderize my heart. 
My flesh is a lousy friend.
